result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess/Distribute/Exhibit an Intimate Representation  (Victim < 18 years old)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Timothy Gordon

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:01 PM Defendant Marcus Timothy Gordon in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Marcus Timothy Gordon.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Anended Information filed. Defendant waives reading of amended information. Guilty Plea entered on Count 1. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of voting rights. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. The Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Sentencing set out at least 60 days to comply with Marsy's law. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

4:17 PM Defendant Marcus Timothy Gordon in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez appeared by video for Marcus Timothy Gordon.  Attorney Craig Nolen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The state provided an offer in this matter. Parties are near resolution. Defense requests 60 days. Bond continues. Matter set over.

10:49 AM Defendant Marcus Timothy Gordon not in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez not in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nolen requests status. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

3:00 PM Defendant Marcus Timothy Gordon in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez appeared by video for Marcus Timothy Gordon.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. The defendant freely and voluntarily waives the preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Atty Gordon waives the formal reading of the complaint and enters a NG plea on the defendants behalf.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
